Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> I'm just asking that you stop the fud.  Personally I have not sold any VRSC in months and don't intend to for quite some time...and having lived on day trading in my past I know a thing or two about irresponsible dumping of small coins and take it seriously in general...but even moreso when it comes to a project in which I have a strong love for and belief in...as I'm sure many other community members here do as well.  Especially those who are here for the long run, contribute regularly to the project, etc.  If I were to look at it logically and make any unsubstantiated claims, it would make more sense to assume someone without a vested interest in and who doesn't contribute to the project's success would be dumping and potentially fudding the community to create ideal dump scenarios.

Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> When Verus was announced, it was done so on Bitcointalk. That's the standard. When you go to find the price & price history on CMC, you can't find it. 
People expect it to be on CMC and there's a level of trust, that comes with that.

Maybe it's just me--and I know a few btc is a lot, it really is. But, in some, way, shape or form---most other projects have paid many times over that, for listings..
